physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Fever, discharge, and swelling observed in the left middle finger at the surgical site; a subcutaneous nodule was noted proximal to the edge of the skin graft.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially treated conservatively, the lesion evolved to recur after four weeks, indicating the presence of a subcutaneous granuloma.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A 3-cm swelling on the left upper arm adjacent to a bacillus Calmette-Guérin scar; the lesion was non-inflamed and presented as a cold abscess.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially treated with surgical excision and subsequently with antibiotics; the lesion improved without the need for antituberculosis medication.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Massive enlargement of the penis and scrotum due to repeated self-injection of liquid paraffin and petroleum jelly. Histological evaluation showed granulomatous inflammation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Post-surgical excision of 2115 g of infiltrated tissue showed no recurrence after four months; erectile and ejaculatory functions were reported as restored.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient presented with subcutaneous nodules in the left upper arm and no signs of inflammation indicating a possible cold abscess or recurrence of cancer.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The granulomas were associated with buried staples from previous surgical procedures.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Cold abscess noted adjacent to the Bacillus Calmette-Guérin vaccination scar; no inflammation present.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Abscess developed after 12 months post-vaccination and required both surgical and conservative management.
